result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome A Watkins

defendant.name: Watkins, Jerome A
defendant.address: MN Department of Corrections, St. Cloud, MN

records.addlTxt:
Cases called at 9:21 AM: 20CF338, 22CF255.
Defendant Jerome A Watkins in court, in custody with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier. Attorney Loralee Clark in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Agreement has been reached. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
20CF338: Defendant pleads to Count 2: Misdemeanor Battery; Domestic Abuse Repeater, an amended Count 4: Disorderly Conduct; Domestic; Repeater, and Count 6: Possession of THC; Repeater.
State to file an Amended Information.
Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 2 Years of Probation with the following conditions:
No contact with L.G., her family, her home, or place of employment. Court Costs/surcharges. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Defendant is granted 2 days credit in 20CF338. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
State's Motion to Impeach Defendant with Prior Convictions
Jury trial - 12 person on May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
See Preliminary Hearing held on 4/7/22 as to detail of the ARGN.

1:30 PM cases 20CF338 and 22CF255 called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jerome A Watkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Jerome A Watkins. 
In both files: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
In both files: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
Parties discuss the jury trial previously scheduled. Court notes it has not yet been scheduled. 
Parties are still in negotiations however the schedule should be placed on the trial calendar. 
Court advises the parties he is not bound by a plea agreement and may or may not accept a plea agreement with the jury trial on the calendar. 
20CF338: A three day jury trial (to comply with time limits on detainer) July 27th, 28th, 29th 2022. 
22CF255: A Final Status Conference is scheduled for 5/5/22 at 9:15 AM. A two day jury trial is scheduled for May 16th and 17th 2022.
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:45 AM Cases are called 22CF255 & 20CF338. Defendant Jerome A Watkins appeared by video, in custody from St. Cloud Correction Institute.  Attorney Loralee Clark for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Defendant has requested a Speedy Trial in writing. Defendant advised of right to an attorney and given the telephone number for the Public Defenders Office. 
20CF338: Warrant quashed. 3 day jury trial set for May 16, 17 & 18.  Preliminary Hearing/Status Conference: 04/07/22 at 1:30pm.
22CF255: Warrant quashed. Bail bond hearing: Bond set. A Preliminary Hearing will be held at the 04/07/22 status conference.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Attempted Not Known, Unable to Forward
